items.title: Transform the way you do HR
items.text: Track, manage, and engage your employees from anywhere as easily as you do in the office.
items.gaTitle: Transform the way you do HR

trending.title: Sage Employee Benefits
trending.desc: Sage Employee Benefits is a package of products and services that bring additional benefits to your employees over and above their salary.

trending.title: Import data from Sage 50 Payroll
trending.desc: Sage 50 HR 2010 v3.2 contains a data import wizard, giving you more control over which data you choose to import into Sage 50 HR from Sage 50 Payroll.

trending.title: Set up and record holidays
trending.desc: Keep track of the holidays that your employees take. You can record holidays in days and if you use Sage 50 HR v3 or above, you can record them in hours.

trending.title: Manage employee absences
trending.desc: In an absence record you can record any time for which an employee is away from work, including holiday, sickness, unauthorised absence or jury service.

trending.title: Add a new employee
trending.desc: An employee's record contains all of the information relating to an individual employee, including contact information and personal details.

trending.title: Record pension scheme details
trending.desc: If your company offers pension schemes to employees, you can record the scheme to which an employee contribute and the date on which they joined the scheme.

trending.title: Sage HR Advice
trending.desc: Sage HR Advice is our advisory service offering legally reliable employment law and human resource advice, translating the law into plain English.

trending.title: Transform the way you do HR
trending.desc: Track, manage, and engage your employees from anywhere as easily as you do in the office.

items.title: Making Tax Digital
items.text: Making Tax Digital for Business (MTD) is a government initiative all about making it easier for you and your clients to manage and pay taxes.
items.altText: Making Tax Digital for Business (MTD) is a government initiative all about making it easier for you and your clients to manage and pay taxes.

trending.title: Processing changes due to Coronavirus
trending.desc: The UK and Republic of Ireland governments have announced emergency measures due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Find out what they are.

trending.title: The UK Job Retention Scheme Data Extract Module
trending.desc: This articles gives you details on the UK JRS data extract module that allows you to create a file detailing your claim for furlough pay.

trending.title: The P11D Module
trending.desc: This article is a guide to setting up and processing P11D returns in SnowdropKCS Payroll for customers with the P11D module.

trending.title: How to check your software is RTR ready
trending.desc: Real Time Reporting (RTR) is the first stage of the Revenue's PAYE Modernisation, check if your software is ready in RTR.

trending.title: ROI Employer's COVID-19 Wage Subsidy Scheme
trending.desc: In response to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, the Irish Government have introduced the Wage Subsidy Scheme, find out more in our detailed article.

trending.title: Holiday pay and changes to calculating average pay from April 2020
trending.desc: HMRC legislation says that UK employees that do not have fixed hours, or fixed rates of pay, must have their holiday pay paid at a rate based on their average earnings over the previous 12 weeks, find out more.

trending.title: How to run the employer alignment list
trending.desc: This article explains the steps on how to run the employer alignment list within SnowdropKCS.

trending.title: How to send payroll submissions.
trending.desc: Employers must report payroll information to the revenue each time their employees are paid., find out how here.

subtitle: Your Microsoft Office 365 Business Premium subscription gives you online access to Microsoft Office plus a range of other services that help make your business more efficient. Here you can find help and support to get the most from Office 365.

about.title: About Office 365
about.description: Learn more about Office 365 Business Premium, including system requirements.

content.title: What is Microsoft Office 365®?
content.content:
Microsoft Office 365® is a range of subscription plans that provide access to:

  • Microsoft Office applications, for example, PowerPoint® and Excel®, plus
  • Additional productivity services that are enabled over the Internet, such as Skype for Business® web conferencing, Exchange Online® hosted email and additional online storage with OneDrive for Business®.

For full details of the Office 365® plan you can purchase from Sage, please refer to article Microsoft Office 365 Business Premium®.

content.title: How is Office 365® different from Microsoft Office®?
content.content:
Although the names are similar, Office 365® and Microsoft Office® are different products with the following key differences.

Office 365®Microsoft Office®
Subscription planOne-off purchase
Office suite plus additional cloud based servicesOffice suite only, with no cloud based services
Automatic feature and security updatesSecurity updates only
Cloud based with desktop options on some plansDesktop based
Integrates with new Sage 50 and Sage 200 apps.No integration with Sage 50 and Sage 200 apps.

content.title: FAQs
content.content: To see the questions people frequently ask about Office 365®, visit the Microsoft article Office 365 for business FAQ.

content.title: Microsoft Office 365 Business Premium®
content.content: To help you run your business more easily and integrate your Microsoft Office® software with Sage 50 or Sage 200, you can purchase an Office 365® Business Premium subscription plan from Sage. This gives you full Office® on your computer or Mac with apps for tablets and phones, plus email, online storage, video conferencing and more.

content.title: Office 365®  Business Premium features
content.content:
With Office 365 Business Premium, you get the following benefits:

Fully installed Office® applications Word®, Excel®, PowerPoint® Outlook®, Publisher® and OneNote® on up to 5 PCs or Macs per user
Office® on tablets and phones for the fully installed Office® experience on up to 5 tablets and 5 phones per user
Online versions of Office® including Word®, Excel® and PowerPoint®
File storage and sharing with 1 TB storage per user
Active Directory integration to easily manage user credentials and permissions
Business class email, calendar, and contacts with a 50 GB inbox per user
Unlimited online meetings with instant messaging, audio, HD video and web conferencing
Corporate social network to help employees collaborate across departments and locations
Work management tools to help teams create plans, organize, assign and collaborate around tasks
Microsoft Teams chat-centered workspace, with instant access to your chats, content, people, and tools
Professional digital storytelling tools to create interactive reports, presentations, and more
Maximum users - 300

content.title: FAQs
content.content: To see the questions people frequently ask about Office 365®, please refer to the Microsoft article Office 365 for business FAQ.

content.title: Microsoft Office 365®  System requirements
content.content:
Before you install or use any Microsoft Office 365® product, we recommend that you verify that your computer meets or exceeds the minimum system requirements for the product. This includes:

  • Checking you use a compatible Internet browser.
  • Checking your computer meets the minimum requirements for any software you choose to install.
  • Checking your mobile devices are compatible.

Tip: You should also check that your computer meets the system requirements for Sage 50, Sage 200 Professional and Sage 200 Standard.

content.title: Internet browsers
content.content:
• Safari, Chrome, and Firefox: Office 365® is designed to work with the current version of the Safari, Chrome, and Firefox browsers.
  • Microsoft Edge: Office 365® is designed to work with the latest version of the Microsoft Edge browser.
  • Internet Explorer: Office 365® is designed to work with the current or immediately previous version of Internet Explorer.

For full details, refer to the Microsoft article System requirements for Office.

content.title: Office standalone applications
content.content:
If you want to install Office applications on your computer or Mac, you must check that it meets the system requirements for each individual application.

For the system requirement details for individual applications, refer to the Microsoft article System requirements for Office.

content.title: Mobile devices
content.content:
• Windows: Office® Mobile applications (Word®, Excel®, PowerPoint®, OneNote®, Outlook Mail®, and Outlook Calendar®) require Windows 10.
  • iOS: Office for iPad® and iPhone® requires iOS 8.0 or later. Office for iPad Pro™ requires iOS 9.0 or later.
  • Android: Office for Android™ can be installed on tablets and phones that meet the following criteria: running Android KitKat 4.4 or later version and have an ARM-based or Intel x86 processor.
  • Mobile browsers: Any mobile browser supported by Microsoft may be used, including the Intune Managed Browser.

basics.title: Office 365 basics
basics.description: How to get started, manage your subscription and find further help.

getstarted.title: Getting started
getstarted.description: Activate your Microsoft Office account and set up Office 365.

content.title: Set up Microsoft Office 365®
content.content: Once you purchase your Office 365 Business Premium® subscription, there are some steps you must take to get up and running. The first is to activate your Office 365® subscription. After that, the rest of the setup depends on what features of Office 365® you plan to use.

content.title: Set up Office 365®
content.content:
Here we summarise the main Office 365® setup steps. Once you activate your account, you can choose which tasks to complete based on your business requirements.

StepFind out more

1. Plan your Office 365® setup.

Whether you want to use Office 365® for one user or many, we recommend that you take a little time to plan your Office 365® setup. Many of the setup steps are optional. Identifying who will use Office 365® and which features they can benefit from helps you plan what you need to do and when.

 

  • Plan your setup of Office 365®
  • Fast Track help to set up 365
  • Microsoft Office 365® adoption guide
  • Microsoft Office 365® System requirements

2. Activate your Office 365® account and the Sage apps

When you purchase your Office 365® subscription from Sage, you receive an email with your new Office 365® administrator user name and a temporary password. To activate your Office 365® subscription and the new Sage apps, click the link on the email and follow the on-screen instructions.

 

3. Integrate with your Sage data

As part of activating your Office 365® subscription, you can upload a copy of your data to Office 365®. This data is used with the Sage 50 and Sage 200 apps.

 

Sage 50 Accounts

  • Upload your accounts data to Office 365®

Sage 200 Standard

  • Connect Sage 200 to your Office 365 account

Sage 200 Professional

  • Connect Sage 200 to your Office 365 account

4. Add additional users to Office 365® and give access to the Sage data and add-ins

As part of your Microsoft Office 365 subscription you can purchase additional licences so others can also use the Office 365 features.

For each person you purchase a licence for, you must add them as a user in Office 365. If you want them to use the new Sage add-ins for Office 365, you must also allow them access to the Sage add-ins and your Sage data.

Sage 50 Accounts

  • Add new users in Microsoft Office 365 and allow access to Sage 50 add-ins

Sage 200 Standard

  • Add new users to Microsoft Office 365
  • Set up user email addresses in Sage 200

Sage 200 Professional

  • Add new users to Microsoft Office 365
  • Set up user email addresses in Sage 200

5. Set up your email and add your domain in Office 365®

When you create a user in Office 365®, this automatically creates their Outlook mailbox so they can start using their new Office 365® email address straight away.

If you have a previous email account, for example, Gmail or your own domain email, you can migrate emails, contacts and calendars into Office 365®. If you want to continue using your previous email address, you can also do this within Office 365®.

 

  • Migrate existing data to Office 365®

6. Install desktop Office 365®

With your Office 365® subscription you have the option to install the full desktop applications for Word®, Excel®, PowerPoint® Outlook®, Publisher® and OneNote® on up to 5 computers or Macs per user.

 

  • Download and install or reinstall Office 365® or Office 2016 on your PC or Mac

7. Set up mobile Office 365® on your devices

With your Office 365® subscription you have the option to install Office on up to 5 tablets and 5 phones per user.

 

  • Set up Office apps and email on a mobile device
  • Microsoft Office 365® on your mobile

8. Download and install Skype for Business®

You and your team members can download and install Skype for Business® on all your computers, Macs, tablets, and phones. Then you can see the online status of your co-workers, start chats from other Office® applications, and host video meetings with up to 250 people.

 

  • Install Skype for Business®
  • Microsoft Skype for Business Online®
  • Skype for Business Online® administration

9. Store and share files online

Office 365® makes online file storage easy.

  • Individuals can store and share documents in OneDrive for Business®.
  • With SharePoint Online® you can have team sites for sharing and collaborating on files.

 

  • Where you can store files in Office 365®
  • SharePoint Online software boundaries and limits
  • Microsoft OneDrive for Business®
  • Microsoft SharePoint Online®
  • SharePoint Online® administration

10. Get started with Office 365®

Now you've set up your Office 365® you're ready to start emailing, creating and sharing documents, and more.

 

  • Get started with Office 365 for Business
  • Work with Office 365®
  • Manage Office 365®

content.title: My Office 365® subscription
content.content:
Within the Office 365 Admin centre you can easily check your subscription at any time, for example, to check what Office 365 plan you have or how many licenses are currently in use. To access the Admin centre:

content.content:
To view your current subscription details, click Billing then click Subscriptions. Here you can see your Office 365 plan, plus the number of licenses purchased and assigned. For more information, refer to Microsoft article What Office 365 for business subscription do I have?

If you'd like to purchase additional licenses, please contact the Sage Sales team on 0800 33 66 33 (UK) or 014 470 806 (ROI).

If you have any queries about your subscription payments, please contact our Sales Support team on 0191 479 5955.

content.title: Manage licences
content.content: For each user you create you must assign them a license in order to use Office 365 features. You can check how your licenses are assigned and change them at any time. For more information, refer to Microsoft article Assign or remove licenses for Office 365 for business.

health.title: Office 365 Service Health
health.description: Check the current status of your Office 365 services.

content.title: Microsoft Office 365® Service Health
content.content: The Service Health feature shows you the current status of your Office 365® services such as Exchange Online® and SharePoint Online®. You can also see details of any service disruptions and information about any planned service maintenance. To use this feature, you must have an admin role that gives you access.

content.title: Check the service status
content.content:
To check the service status:

  1. Visit https://portal.office.com/adminportal/home and sign in using your Office 365® admin account.

    2. Tip: You can also access Service Health within the Office 365® Admin centre.

    The Admin centre dashboard shows the current service status.

  2. To view individual service details, click Service Health.
  3. To view the service history over the last 30 days, click the required service, for example, Exchange Online, then click View history.
  4. To return to the current service status, click View current.

content.title: Check for planned maintenance
content.content:
To check for planned maintenance:

  1. Visit https://portal.office.com/adminportal/home and sign in using your Office 365® admin account.

    2. Tip: You can also access Service Health within the Office 365® Admin centre.

  2. In the Admin centre dashboard, click Message centre.
  3. In the Views drop-down list click Plan for change.
  4. To view the full details of a message, click the message.

content.title: Service notifications on your mobile
content.content: If you're on the go, you can receive service notifications to your mobile device using the Office 365® Admin app. You can get the app from the Apple Store, Google Play and from the Windows Store. Read more >>

data.title: Data migration
data.description: Move existing email data and other information to Office 365.

content.title: Migrate existing data to Microsoft Office 365®
content.content:
You may be new to Office 365, but you probably already have a business email address, either through a webmail provider such as Gmail, or through your own domain. You may also have existing IT systems such as a mail server, company intranet, video conferencing or data storage servers.

When it comes to migrating to Office 365, each migration is unique. The steps depend on what you want to transfer to Office 365, for example, a full migration of all systems, a partial migration of just some aspects, or even just your email or data storage.

Due to the potential complexity, we can't support you with migrating or connecting your existing systems to Office 365. However, to get you started, here we've pulled together some useful support resources. If you'd like further help with this from a Microsoft partner, you can find a list of partners in the Office 365 Marketplace.

content.title: Do I have to migrate my old emails?
content.content: Office 365 provides a new, ready-to-use, email address and mailbox for each user. If you don't intend to use your old email address, and don't want to transfer old emails, you can simply start using your new email address.

content.title: Migrate emails to Office 365
content.content:
Connected accounts

If you have only a few mailboxes to transfer to Office 365, the easiest way is to use connected accounts. A connected account allows Office 365 to send and receive mail for a mailbox that's hosted outside your Office 365. For example, Gmail, Yahoo Mail or your own domain email. It uses POP or IMAP settings to download existing emails stored on the other mail server, and any new emails you receive. Connected accounts don't change anything in the original email account, so you can continue to access emails through the original system if required.

Note: When you send an email from a connected account, it shows as sent from your Office 365 email address on behalf of the connected account address.

If you use Hotmail, Outlook.com, Yahoo Mail or Gmail, for further help please refer to the following articles:

  • 35339 - Connect your Hotmail or Outlook.com account to your Office 365 Outlook Web App
  • 35332 - Connect Gmail to your Office 365 Outlook Web App
  • 35340 - Connect AOL Mail to your Office 365 Outlook Web App
  • 35331 - Connect Yahoo Mail to your Office 365 Outlook Web App

If you're using any other webmail or email, please refer to the following articles:

  • 35440 - Connecting Office 365 to your existing email, contacts and calendar
  • Microsoft article - Connect email accounts in Outlook on the web (Office 365)

 

Migrating a custom domain

If your business has its own domain web address, to use this domain for your emails within Office 365 you can add the domain to Office 365.

For help with this, please refer to the following articles:

  • 35314 - How to migrate your domain email and DNS settings to Office 365
  • Add users and domain to Office 365

Note: Once you migrate your domain to Office 365, any new incoming emails redirect to Office 365 and emails are no longer delivered to your previous email system.

 

Migration from Exchange Server 2003 or above

If you currently use Exchange Server 2003 or above, you can migrate emails, contacts, calendars and tasks for multiple mailboxes to Exchange Online. There are 3 types of migration you can choose, depending on your requirements:

  • Cutover - If you've less than 150 mailboxes to migrate and you want to migrate quickly over a weekend or a few days. Read more >>
  • Staged - If you're migrating from Exchange 2003 or 2007, and you've over 150 mailboxes to migrate or you want to migrate small groups of users at a time. Read more >>
  • Hybrid - If you're migrating from Exchange 2010 or above, and you've over 150 mailboxes to migrate or you want to migrate small groups of users at a time. Read more >>

For a customised guide based on your requirements, visit the Exchange Server Deployment Assistant.

You can also get further help within the Office 365 Data Migration admin area:

  1. Sign in to Office 365 with your administrator Office ID, click the app selector then click Admin.
  2. Click Users , then click Data Migration.

 

Migration from Exchange Server 2000 or below and other email systems

For earlier versions of Exchange Server and other email systems that support IMAP, you can use IMAP migration to move users' emails from their Inbox and other mail folders. Before you do this, you must create the users in Office 365. Read more >>

Note: IMAP migration doesn't transfer contacts, calendars and tasks, however, each user can transfer these individually. Read more >>

content.title: Migrate other data to Office 365
content.content:
In addition to your email system, there are other Office 365 services that you may want to migrate data to, for example, SharePoint and OneDrive for Business. The following Microsoft articles and guides can help you with this:

SharePoint
  • Migrate to SharePoint Online
  • Upload on-premises content to SharePoint Online
Yammer
  • Yammer Enterprise setup guide - Log in with your Office 365 admin details
  • Manage the Yammer service in Office 365
Skype for Business
  • Skype for Business Server 2015 - Move users to Skype for Business Online
  • Lync 2013 cutover migration to Skype for Business online
OneDrive for Business
  • OneDrive for Business setup guide - Log in with your Office 365 admin details
  • Set up your computer to sync your OneDrive for Business files in Office 365
  • Redirect known folders to OneDrive for Business
Troubleshooting
  • Video - Office 365 Troubleshooting common migration Issues

You can also get further help with migration in the Office 365 Data Migration admin area:

  1. Sign in to Office 365 with your administrator Office ID, click the app selector then click Admin.
  2. Click Users , then click Data Migration.

Tip: For a list of partners who can provide one to one support with migration, visit the Office 365 Marketplace.

sage-apps.title: Sage connected apps
sage-apps.description: Integrate your Sage software with Microsoft Office 365.

sage-contact.title: Sage Contact
sage-contact.description: Business contacts at your fingertips in Microsoft Outlook.

content.title: Sage Contact
content.content:
Sage Contact gives you easy access to business contact information from your Sage software, within Microsoft Outlook 365. So you always have up to date information when dealing with customers and suppliers.

  • Spend less time switching back and forward between emails and your Sage software.
  • View customer and supplier record information when creating and reading emails.
  • See recent sales and communication history for contacts.
  • Update contact details from within Outlook and sync the changes to your Sage software.
  • Add notes to contact records and see notes posted by colleagues.

Available in

In the UK, Sage Contact is currently available with the following Sage software:

Sage 50 Accounts
  • Activate your Microsoft Office 365 integration now
  • Open and use the Microsoft Office 365 Sage Contact add-in
Sage 200 Standard
  • Set up the Sage Contact app for Microsoft Office 365
  • Use the Sage Contact app with Microsoft Office 365
Sage 200 Professional
  • Set up the Sage Contact app for Microsoft Office 365
  • Use the Sage Contact app with Microsoft Office 365

cloud-storage.title: Cloud document storage
cloud-storage.description: Store copies of Sage documents you send in Microsoft OneDrive.

content.title: Cloud document storage
content.content:
Cloud document storage saves you both time and storage space. When you print or email documents from your Sage software, you can save copies to Microsoft OneDrive at the same time. So you have a secure copy of each document you send, without the need to print and store duplicates.

  • Control which types of document are stored in Microsoft OneDrive.
  • Choose to save documents automatically, or if you prefer, ask for confirmation before each document is saved.
  • Access stored documents quickly from within your Sage software.
  • Easily share documents with colleagues.

Available in

In the UK, the cloud document storage feature is currently available with the following Sage software:

Sage 50 Accounts
  • Activate your Microsoft Office 365 integration now
  • Send documents to Microsoft OneDrive from Sage 50 Accounts
Sage 200 Standard
  • Save printed documents to cloud storage
Sage 200 Professional
  • Save printed documents to cloud storage

sage-capture.title: Sage Capture
sage-capture.description: Post invoices and expenses on the go from your mobile.

content.title: Sage Capture
content.content:
Process income and expenses immediately instead of waiting until you're back in the office. With Sage Capture you can photograph expenses, invoices or other paperwork, save them to Microsoft OneDrive and post a corresponding transaction to your Sage software, all from your mobile or tablet.

  • Capture an image and post a corresponding income or expense transaction.
  • Capture and save an image only.
  • View images from within your Sage software or directly in Microsoft OneDrive.
  • Available for iOS and Android.

Available in

In the UK, the Sage Capture app can be used with the following Sage software:

Sage 50 Accounts
  • Activate your Microsoft Office 365 integration now
  • Sage Capture

business-dashboard.title: Sage Business Dashboard
business-dashboard.description: Check your business performance at a glance.

content.title: Sage Business Dashboard
content.content:
With the Sage Dashboard you can see how your business is performing at a glance, even when you're out of the office.

  • Accessed through your Microsoft Office 365 login, anytime, on any device.
  • Graphical representation of receivables, payables, revenue and expenses.
  • Drill down on values for a further breakdown.
  • View overdue customer and supplier transaction details.

Available in

In the UK, you can use the Sage Dashboard with the following Sage software:

Sage 50 Accounts
  • Activate your Microsoft Office 365 integration now
  • Sage Dashboard for Sage 50 Accounts

sage-intelligence.title: Sage 50 Intelligence
sage-intelligence.description: Access up-to-date, in depth financial reports on the go.

content.title: Sage 50 Intelligence
content.content:
Sage 50 Intelligence gives you a deeper understanding of your business through powerful Microsoft Excel reports that you can access anytime, anywhere.

  • Up to date financial reports accessed online in Microsoft Office 365.
  • Contains a range of standard, ready to use reports.
  • Create your own reports to suit your needs.
  • Download your reports to desktop Microsoft Excel.
  • Export reports to share with others.

Available in

In the UK, you can use Sage Intelligence with the following Sage software:

Sage 50 Accounts
  • Activate your Microsoft Office 365 integration now
  • Sage 50 Intelligence

cloud-backup.title: Cloud backup
cloud-backup.description: Automatic backups stored securely in Microsoft OneDrive.

content.title: Sage cloud backup
content.content:
It's important to protect your accounts data by making regular backups. Cloud backup saves you time and gives you the peace of mind that your data is protected, even when you're out of the office. With cloud backup you can set up automatic backups which upload to Microsoft OneDrive, storing them securely in the cloud.

  • Set your backup frequency to suit your business needs.
  • Continue to work on your accounts as data is backed up.
  • Receive an email to show the status of each backup.
  • Easily retrieve backups from Microsoft OneDrive if needed.
  • Replaces the need for regular manual backups.

Available in

In the UK, the cloud backup feature is available in the following Sage software:

Sage 50 Accounts
  • Activate your Microsoft Office 365 integration now
  • Cloud backup using Office 365 OneDrive

content.title: Microsoft Powerapps integration
content.content:
With Microsoft Powerapps you can build and customise fully functional mobile apps in a visual designer environment, without having to write code.

  • Have data at you fingertips, anywhere and anytime.
  • Create mobile apps tailored to your business.

Available in

In the UK, Microsoft Powerapps integration is available for the following Sage software:

Sage 200
  • Microsoft Powerapps and Sage 200

content.title: Microsoft Power Automate integration
content.content:
With Microsoft Power Automate you can automate tasks by integrating your favorite apps with your Sage software.

  • Save time by automating repetitive tasks.
  • Send automatic notofications.

Available in

In the UK, Microsoft Power Automate integration is available for the following Sage software:

Sage 200
  • Microsoft Power Automate and Sage 200

work.title: Work with Office 365
work.description: Work smarter with the Microsoft Office 365 services and apps.

outlook.title: Microsoft Outlook
outlook.description: Work with emails, calendars and contacts.

content.title: Microsoft Office 365® -  Outlook®
content.content: You can use Microsoft Outlook® to manage your emails, contacts and calendar, helping you to stay connected and productive. It's available online via your Office 365® login, known as the Outlook® Web App (OWA) or for more advanced features you can install the Outlook® 2016 desktop application. When you're on the go, you can also use Outlook® on your iOS, Android or Windows devices. To help you get the most from Outlook®, here we've pulled together some common questions, training information and support resources.

content.title: Get started with the Outlook® Web App
content.content:
To start working with your emails in the Outlook® Web App:

  • Sign in to Office 365 with your Office ID, click the app selector then click Mail.

The following Microsoft articles will help you get up and running:

  • Sign in to Outlook on the web for business
  • Getting started in Outlook® Web App
  • Calendar in Outlook® on the web for business
  • People overview

content.title: Get started with the Outlook® desktop application
content.content:
As part of your Office 365® for Business subscription, you can also install the latest desktop version of Outlook. Once installed, you can link Outlook® to your Office 365® account using the automatic account setup feature. The following Microsoft articles will help you quickly get started:

  • Upgrade to Office 2016 using Office 365® for business
  • Download and install or reinstall Office 365® or Office 2016 on your PC or Mac
  • Outlook® email setup
  • Outlook® help
  • How to create a profile and set up an email account in Outlook
  • Change email account settings

content.title: Outlook® for mobile
content.content:
Here are some common questions that people ask about Outlook®:

  • How to set up automatic out of office replies
  • Can I recover deleted items?
  • How do I use Clutter?
  • How do I share my Office 365® calendar?
  • How do I set up a Skype® meeting?
  • Can I export or back up my messages, calendar, tasks and contacts?
  • How do I add an email signature in Outlook® Web App?
  • How to use a shared mailbox in Outlook® Web App
  • Create and add members to a contact group in Outlook® Web App
  • Schedule a meeting with other people using Outlook® Web App
  • How to manage another person's calendar in Outlook® Web App
  • How do I add an email signature in desktop Outlook®?
  • How to use a shared mailbox in Outlook®
  • Can I recall an email I sent in desktop Outlook®?
  • Create and add members to a contact group in desktop Outlook®
  • Schedule a meeting with other people using desktop Outlook®
  • How to manage another person's calendar in desktop Outlook®
  • Mail and calendar for Windows 10 FAQs

Find more answers >>

sharepoint.title: Microsoft SharePoint Online
sharepoint.description: A space for your team to share documents and information.

content.title: Microsoft SharePoint Online®
content.content: SharePoint Online® is a collaboration service that helps teams work better together. It provides a central space where your team can upload and share documents, work on documents collectively, share information via news feeds and more. You can access information securely from almost any device, anywhere, all you need is a web browser. Read more >>

content.title: What to store where
content.content:
You may already be using OneDrive® to store documents, or if you're new to Office 365® you may wonder when you should use OneDrive® and when to use SharePoint®. For help with what to store where, best practices for file storage and sharing, and what to think about when planning your SharePoint® site, take a look at the following Microsoft articles:

  • Set up Office 365® file storage and sharing
  • SharePoint Online® Planning Guide for Office 365® for business

content.title: Get started
content.content:
If you want to create a SharePoint® site, the following Microsoft articles walk you through the process:

  • Create a SharePoint® site
  • Customize your team site
  • Share a site
  • How to create and edit Permission Levels

Tip: Sites that you create in SharePoint Online® include accessibility features that make it easier for people with disabilities to use them. Read more >>

If you want to work with an existing SharePoint® site, find out more in the following Microsoft articles:

  • Video: Follow a SharePoint® site
  • Get started with SharePoint®
  • Share files or folders in Office 365®

For lots of help with managing and using SharePoint®, visit Microsoft article Find content about SharePoint Online®. If you're a SharePoint® administrator, you can also get further information in our article SharePoint Online administration.

content.title: SharePoint® for mobile
content.content:
You can access SharePoint® on your mobile device via your Internet browser, anywhere you have an Internet connection.

  • Use a mobile device to work with SharePoint Online® sites
  • Share documents by using a mobile device

If you use an iPhone, iPad or iPod touch with iOS 8.0 or later, your mobile SharePoint® experience is improved with the new Microsoft SharePoint® mobile app for iOS. This makes using SharePoint® on the go even easier and faster, with simple navigation and quick access to sites you follow or use most often.

  • SharePoint® mobile app for iOS

Apps for Windows and Android are coming soon.

content.title: Training
content.content:
If you'd like to learn more about common tasks in SharePoint Online®, visit the following Microsoft online training areas:

  • SharePoint Online® training
  • SharePoint® training videos

For the latest SharePoint® news plus handy tips, visit the SharePoint® Office Blog.

content.title: FAQs
content.content:
Here are some common questions that people ask about SharePoint®.

  • Are there any size limits on the files I can share in SharePoint Online®?
  • Can I sync SharePoint® files to a folder on my computer?
  • How do I upload a file to SharePoint®?
  • Can I share a site or document with people outside my organisation?
  • Can I edit permissions on an individual file or folder?
  • How do I track changes to documents in SharePoint®?

For SharePoint® administration or troubleshooting help, please refer to article SharePoint Online administration.

onedrive.description: Store your files in the cloud and share them with others.

content.content: Microsoft Office 365® is a fully cloud based solution, this means you can access your files anytime and anywhere. OneDrive for Business gives you one place to store, share, and sync your work or school files. To help you get the most when using your mobile device, here we've pulled together some common questions, training information and support resources. skype.title: Microsoft Skype for Business
skype.description: Instant messaging, online meetings and video conferencing.

content.title: Microsoft Skype for Business Online®
content.content: You can use Skype for Business® to connect with co-workers and business partners in your company or around the world. It includes instant messaging, online meetings, voice calls and video conferencing calling, on your computer and also your mobile devices. Read more >>

content.title: Get started
content.content:
To get started, there are some tasks the Office 365® administrator must do first to set up Skype for Business® for your organisation. Once that's done, to start using Skype for Business® you must first download and install it on your computer then sign in. You can then set up your computer’s built-in mic and speakers, a headset, or another device for Skype for Business® audio.

  • Install Skype for Business®
  • Sign in to and out of Skype for Business®
  • Set up an audio device for Skype for Business®

You're now ready to start using Skype for Business®. For help on how to use to all the great features, refer to the following Microsoft article:

  • Skype for Business® help
  • Skype for Business® quick start guides

Tip: Skype for Business® includes accessibility features that make it easier for people with disabilities to use it. Read more >>

If you're a Skype for Business® administrator, you can also get further information in our article Skype for Business Online administration.

content.title: Skype for Business® for mobile
content.content:
You can access Skype for Business® on your iPhone, iPad, Android and Windows mobile devices.

  • Install Skype for Business® on a mobile device - iOS
  • Install Skype for Business® on a mobile device - Android
  • Install Skype for Business® on a mobile device - Windows

Once you install Skype for Business® on your mobile device, you can find further help in the following Microsoft articles:

  • Help for Skype for Business® on a mobile device - iOS
  • Help for Skype for Business® on a mobile device - Android
  • Help for Skype for Business® on a mobile device - Windows phone

For the latest Skype® news plus handy tips, visit the Skype® blog.

You can organise your notes so you can find things easily, and share information with others so everyone's on the same page. Whether you’re at home, in the office, or out and about, you can use OneNote wherever you go. To help you get the most from OneNote, here we've pulled together some common questions, training information and support resources.

Office 365 Teams® is a chat-based workspace that brings together people, conversations and your files in one place so you can easily collaborate with your colleagues.

You can:

  • Create channels to keep your team conversations organised.
  • Chat with other people in your team and view your chat history.
  • Upload files and share them with the team.

manage.title: Manage Office 365
manage.description: Support with administration and troubleshooting in Microsoft Office 365.

health.title: Office 365 Service Health
health.description: Check the current status of your Office 365 services.

content.title: Microsoft Office 365®  Service Health
content.content: The Service Health feature shows you the current status of your Office 365® services such as Exchange Online® and SharePoint Online®. You can also see details of any service disruptions and information about any planned service maintenance. To use this feature, you must have an admin role that gives you access.

content.title: Check the service status
content.content:
To check the service status:

  1. Visit https://portal.office.com/adminportal/home and sign in using your Office 365® admin account.

    2. Tip: You can also access Service Health within the Office 365® Admin centre.

    The Admin centre dashboard shows the current service status.

  2. To view individual service details, click Service Health.
  3. To view the service history over the last 30 days, click the required service, for example, Exchange Online, then click View history.
  4. To return to the current service status, click View current.

content.title: Check for planned maintenance
content.content:
To check for planned maintenance:

  1. Visit https://portal.office.com/adminportal/home and sign in using your Office 365® admin account.

    2. Tip: You can also access Service Health within the Office 365® Admin centre.

  2. In the Admin centre dashboard, click Message centre.
  3. In the Views drop-down list click Plan for change.
  4. To view the full details of a message, click the message.

content.title: Service notifications on your mobile
content.content: If you're on the go, you can receive service notifications to your mobile device using the Office 365® Admin app. You can get the app from the Apple Store, Google Play and from the Windows Store. Read more >>

content.title: Microsoft Exchange Online®
content.content:
Office 365® includes Exchange Online®, a hosted messaging application that gives you Exchange Server features in a cloud based service. It controls email access, calendars, contacts and tasks across devices. As an Exchange Online® administrator, you can manage message-related tasks from within Office 365® using the Office Exchange admin centre. To help you with this, here we've pulled together some common questions, training information and support resources.

In addition, you can use Windows PowerShell, to connect to Exchange Online® to perform management tasks that aren't available or practical using the admin centre.  For example, automation of repetitive tasks or connecting Exchange Online® to existing infrastructure and processes. For more information, please refer to Microsoft articles Using PowerShell with Exchange Online® and Managing Office 365® and Exchange Online® with Windows PowerShell.

content.title: The Exchange admin centre
content.content:
The Office Exchange admin centre is where you can manage Exchange specific settings. To access the admin centre:

  1. Sign in to Office 365® with your Office ID, click the app selector then click Admin.
  2. Click Admin centers , then click Exchange.

Once in the Office Exchange admin centre, you can access the following areas:

Recipients

View and manage your mailboxes and mailbox migrations, distribution groups, contacts, calendars and scheduling.

 

  • Read more about recipients features >>
  • Read more about managing user mailboxes >>
  • Read more about connecting to existing emails, contacts and calendars >>

Permissions

Manage administrator roles, user roles, and Outlook® Web App policies.

 

  • Read more >>

Compliance management

Manage In-Place eDiscovery and Hold, auditing, data loss prevention, retention policies, retention tags, and journal rules.

 

  • Read more >>

Organisation

Manage organisation sharing and apps for Outlook®.

 

  • Read more about sharing >>
  • Read more about apps for Outlook® >>

Protection

Manage malware filters, connection filters, content filters, outbound spam, and quarantine for your organisation.

 

  • Read more about anti-malware protection >>
  • Read more about anti-spam protection >>
  • Read more about Quarantine >>

Mail flow

Manage mail flow rules, delivery reports, message tracing, accepted domains and connectors.

 

  • Read more about mail flow rules >>
  • Read more about mail flow best practices >>
  • Read more about monitoring, reporting and message tracing >>

Mobile

Manage the mobile devices that you allow to connect to your organisation. You can manage mobile device access and mobile device mailbox policies.

 

  • Read more >>

Public folders

Manage public folders and public folder mailboxes.

 

  • Read more >>

Unified messaging

Unified Messaging (UM) gives users access to voice mail features. Here you can manage UM dial plans and UM IP gateways.

 

  • Read more >>

Hybrid

With an Exchange® hybrid deployment you can connect and manage both your on-premises and Exchange Online® organisations. Here you can configure your hybrid deployment.

 

  • Read more >>

For more help with Exchange Online® visit the Microsoft TechNet areas:

  • Exchange Online®
  • Exchange® for IT pros

If you'd like to learn more about common tasks in Exchange Online®, visit the Microsoft Virtual Academy:

content.title: Microsoft Office 365® admin centre
content.content:
The Office 365® admin centre is used to set up your organisation in the cloud, manage users, manage subscriptions, and more. For an overview of the admin centre and links to common management tasks for Office 365®, take a look at the following Microsoft articles:

  • About the Office 365® admin centre
  • Common management tasks for Office 365®
  • Office 365 for Business® administrator help

content.title: Set up Office 365®
content.content: For help with setting up your organisation in Office 365®, please refer to article Set up Microsoft Office 365®.

content.title: Users, passwords and groups
content.content:
The people on your team each need a user account before they can sign in and access Office 365 for Business®. You can add user accounts one at a time, or in bulk. Once you do this, your users will have Office 365® licenses, logon credentials, and Office 365® mailboxes.

  • Add users individually or in bulk to Office 365® - Admin Help

Common tasks for users and passwords include:

  • Resetting a password for one or more users in Office 365®
  • Deleting a user
  • Resetting your administrator password
  • Assigning administrator roles in Office 365®
  • Assigning or removing licenses for Office 365 for Business®

content.title: Office 365® Admin  app
content.content: If you're an Office 365® administrator that's usually on the go, you can use the Office 365® Admin app to manage Office 365® from your phone or tablet. You can get the app from the Apple Store, Google Play and from the Windows Store. Read more >>

content.title: Mobile Device management (MDM)
content.content:
You can manage and secure mobile devices when they're connected to your Office 365® organisation by using Mobile Device Management for Office 365®. You can set device security policies and access rules and also wipe mobile devices if they’re lost or stolen.

  • Overview of Mobile Device Management (MDM) for Office 365®
  • Set up Mobile Device Management (MDM) in Office 365®

content.title: Security and compliance
content.content:
If your business has specific security requirements for controlling sensitive information, you can use the Office 365® security and compliance features. To find out about these features and also how Office 365® uses encryption and other security technologies to protect your data, refer to the following Microsoft article:

  • Security and Compliance in Office 365 for Business® - Admin Help

content.title: Billing
content.content: For billing and subscription management, please refer to article My Office 365® subscription.

For help with troubleshooting issues in Office 365®, you may find the following articles useful:

Here we list some of the more common questions people ask about managing Office 365®.

  • How do I get Office 365® updates?
  • I'm an administrator but I don't have an option to install Office.
  • How do I install the latest version of Office on more than five computers?

content.title: SharePoint Online® administration
content.content:
As a SharePoint Online® administrator you can configure and manage SharePoint® to meet your organisation's requirements. This includes tasks such as managing user profiles and site collections, configuring the SharePoint® search experience, managing permissions and more.

Tip: For help with general use of SharePoint Online®, please refer to article Microsoft SharePoint Online®.

content.title: Administrator roles
content.content:
There are three main administrative roles available for SharePoint Online®. A Global administrator, a SharePoint Online® administrator and a Site collection administrator. The following Microsoft articles explains more about these roles:

  • Manage administrators for a site collection
  • About the SharePoint Online® admin role

content.title: Administration centre
content.content:
You can manage SharePoint Online® in the following ways:

  • SharePoint Online® Administration Centre - If you're new to Office 365® and SharePoint Online®, or you haven't done much managing of SharePoint® sites or users, this is a good place to start. The rest of this article is based around the Administration Centre.

    To get started in the Administration Centre, sign in to Office 365, select the app selector , then click Admin. Click Admin centers , then click SharePoint.
  • SharePoint Online® Management Shell - Once you're familiar with SharePoint Online® sites and users, you can use this Windows PowerShell module to manage SharePoint Online® users, sites, and site collections. This is a more efficient way to manage SharePoint®, especially if you want to manage you want to manage lots of users, sites, or site collections. Find out more in the Microsoft® TechNet article SharePoint Online® administration.

content.content:

  • Guided walkthroughs and wizards for Exchange®, Lync®, SharePoint®, and Office 365®

content.title: Skype for Business Online® administration
content.content:
As an Office 365® global administrator, you can manage the Skype for Business Online® administration for your organisation. This includes the initial Skype for Business Online® setup, feature management, plus troubleshooting any issues your colleagues may come across when using Skype for Business Online®.

Tip: For help with general use of Skype for Business Online®, please refer to article Microsoft Skype for Business Online®.

content.title: Set up Skype for Business Online®
content.content:
To set up Skype for Business Online®, the following steps need to be done by the person who purchased the Skype for Business Online® subscription, or someone else in your business who is assigned to the Office 365® global admin role.

  1. Sign in to Office 365®.
  2. Set up your domain and users.
  3. Set up instant messaging and presence in your organisation.
  4. Download and install Skype for Business Online®.
  5. Test to make sure everything is working.
  6. Add more features: dial-in conferencing, PSTN calling, and Skype Meeting Broadcast.

For full details, please refer to the following Microsoft articles:

  • Set up Skype for Business Online®
  • Optimising your network for Skype for Business Online®

content.title: Skype for Business admin role
content.content:
To give other users permissions to manage Skype for Business Online®, you can assign them to the Skype for Business Online® admin role.

For more information about the tasks a Skype for Business Online® administrator can do, please refer to Microsoft article About the Skype for Business® admin role.

For further help with managing Skype for Business Online®, please refer to Microsoft article Skype for Business Online® in Office 365® – Admin Help.

content.title: Microsoft Yammer® administration
content.content:
As an Office 365® administrator, you can manage the Yammer® administration for your organisation. This includes managing Yammer® users and licenses, creating and managing Yammer® groups, plus troubleshooting any issues your colleagues may come across when using Yammer®.

Tip: For help with general use of Yammer®, please refer to article Microsoft Yammer®.

content.title: Set up Yammer®

The following Microsoft articles and training will help you set up and manage Yammer® in your organisation:

content.title: Microsoft Office  365 Groups®
content.content:
Office 365 Groups® is a service that helps you easily share information and collaborate with others. It works with the Office 365® apps you already use, so you can collaborate when writing documents, creating spreadsheets, scheduling meetings and more.

An Office 365® group includes the following:

  • A distribution list, Inbox and shared calendar.
  • A document library.
  • A OneNote® notebook.
  • A planning tool.

When you join a group, you gain access to all the shared information for that group.

content.title: Get started with groups
content.content:
The following Microsoft articles will help you get up and running with groups:

  • Create a group in Outlook® or OneDrive®
  • Create a group in Yammer®
  • Get the most out of Office 365 Groups® in Outlook®
  • Join a group in Outlook®
  • Join a group in Yammer®
  • Subscribe to a group in Outlook® 2016

content.title: Manage your groups
content.content:
Office 365® group members can create their own groups, add themselves to groups that they want to join, or are invited by group owners. If you're a global administrator, you can also add and remove users for a group. The following Microsoft articles can help you manage groups:

  • Manage group membership in the Office 365® admin centre
  • Office 365 Groups® - Admin help
  • Multi-domain support for Office 365 Groups® - Admin help
  • Add and remove group members in Office 365®
  • Add and remove group members in Outlook 2016®
  • Delete a group

content.title: Outlook Groups for mobile
content.content:
You can use the Outlook Groups mobile app to access your group's shared mailbox and OneNote® notebook on your mobile device. For help with this, refer to the following Microsoft articles:

  • Connect apps to your groups
  • Compare Office 365 Groups® on all platforms

azure.title: Microsoft Azure
azure.description: A cloud based identity management and access control service.

content.title: Microsoft Azure® Active Directory
content.content:
Microsoft Azure® Active Directory (AD) is a cloud based identity management and access control service. If you have a paid subscription to Office 365®, you also have a free subscription to Azure® AD. With this you can:

  • Manage users, groups and device registration.
  • Synchronize with on-premises directories using Azure® AD Connect.
  • Set up single sign-on across Office 365® and thousands of popular software as a service (SaaS) applications, such as Salesforce, Google Apps, DropBox and more.
  • View user access and usage reports.

Tip: To use Sage 200 with Office 365®, you must have either Azure® AD Basic or Premium. These are paid for services. If you need to upgrade, please contact the supplier you originally purchased Office 365® from. Read more >>

content.title: Get started
content.content:
To activate your free subscription you must complete a one-time registration. Once you register, to access the Azure® management portal you can browse to https://manage.windowsazure.com and sign in using the global administrator account that was used to create your Office 365® organisation.

Alternatively, log in to Office 365® using your administrator login details then:

  1. Click the app selector then click Admin.
  2. Click Admin centers, then click Azure AD.

To get started with Azure® AD, you may find the following articles useful:

  • Azure® integration with Office 365®
  • Understanding Office 365® identity and Azure® Active Directory
  • Administer your Azure® AD directory
  • Get started with Azure® Active Directory Device Registration
  • Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure® Active Directory
  • View your access and usage reports

content.title: Training
content.content:
If you want to learn more about Azure® AD, visit the following Microsoft online training areas:

  • Microsoft Virtual Academy - Microsoft Azure® Courses
  • Microsoft Azure® videos

For the latest Azure® news plus handy tips, visit the Microsoft Azure® blog.

subtext: The latest information on HMRC's planned changes.
We've gathered all the resources and information you need to use Sage Online Services.
Access help and support directly in your software any time.

items.title: Sage Employee Benefits
items.text: An employee benefits package that gives your people perks and opportunities beyond their salaries.

trending.title: What is Sage 50 P11D?
trending.desc: If you provide taxable benefits, such as company cars or medical insurance to your employees, you can use Sage 50 P11D to submit to HMRC at the end of each tax year.

trending.title: Legislation changes
trending.desc: With Sage 50 P11D, you can be confident your software is up to date with the latest legislation with the following rates and thresholds for the 2020/21 tax year.

trending.title: Print your employee P11D forms
trending.desc: You must provide a copy to each of your employees every tax year. This article covers how to print your employee P11D forms in Sage 50 P11D.

trending.title: Install your software update
trending.desc: To ensure that you're up to date with all the required legislation, it's important that you install the latest version of Sage 50 P11D.

trending.title: What's new in P11D?
trending.desc: The Sage 50 P11D software update includes new features and improvements.  This article lists the changes made in the latest update.

trending.title: How to back up and restore your data
trending.desc: We recommend that you take regular backups of your data so if anything happens to your computer, or you make a mistake, you can restore the backup and continue processing where you left off.

trending.title: Payrolling benefits vs. P11D
trending.desc: If you provide taxable benefits or benefits in kind (BIKs) to your employees, for example company cars or medical insurance, you need to submit a P11D(b) form to HMRC by 6 July each year.

trending.title: P11D year end
trending.desc: In July each year, employers are required by HMRC to submit information about benefits in kind received by their employees.  This article explains how to process this year end in Sage 50 P11D.
